definitions.definition: To feign illness , injury , or incapacitation in order to avoid work , obligation , or perilous risk.
examples: It is not uncommon on exam days for several students to malinger rather than prepare themselves.

definitions.definition: To self-inflict real injury or infection (to inflict self-harm ) in order to avoid work , obligation , or perilous risk.

main_definition: ( ambitransitive ) To feign illness , injury , or incapacitation in order to avoid work , obligation , or perilous risk.
secondary_definitions: ( ambitransitive ) To self-inflict real injury or infection (to inflict self-harm ) in order to avoid work , obligation , or perilous risk.
